User Interface¶

Starting CONTACT Tasks¶

Accessing CONTACT Tasks

Click on the Tasks symbol in the navigation area. CONTACT Tasks will open.

Note

Click on the hamburger symbol to manipulate the navigation area representation. You will either see the symbol for the application or the symbol plus the name of the application.

Sub-areas of CONTACT Tasks¶

Sub-areas of CONTACT Tasks

The CONTACT Tasks interface can be divided into five areas, as shown in the Sub-areas of CONTACT Tasks diagram:

  • Menu bar
  • Editing options
  • Grouping bar
  • Table
  • Detail area

Menu bar¶

You can execute two functions in the menu bar.

  • You can select a user to view their capacity or to delegate tasks. (This function is only available if you have the required permissions).
  • You can alter the position of the detail area by clicking the Position detail area symbol. The detail area can either be displayed below the table or to the right of the table.

Grouping bar¶

Displays the column headers used to group the table.

Editing options¶

In the editing options area, you can:

  • Filter
  • Change the settings of the table

Filter¶

The filter symbol reduces the range of the table to the desired size.

Settings¶

Settings can be used to define any number of view types to represent your tasks.

Table¶

The Table displays information about your tasks.

The representation of the data can vary greatly as the view type determines the information displayed.

Detail area¶

The detail area displays further information about the selected task. The detail area can contain a number of different units of information depending on the task type. These units of information can be individually minimized or expanded.

Note

Information is only displayed in the detail area if you have selected a task in the table.

Note

Since the detail area can be displayed very differently next to the table depending on the chosen task type, the Project Tasks task object has been used to illustrate how CONTACT Tasks works.
